description:
*** This app requires an active internet connection and a CellarTracker account. ***

Make managing your wine cellar fun with Wino-File and CellarTracker. Wino-File provides an elegant, tablet optimized interface to access your wine collection as stored in CellarTracker. To sign up for a CellarTracker account please visit www.cellartracker.com.

With a variety of ways to view your cellar, you'll always find the perfect bottle. Flexible searches allow you to quickly pinpoint what you are looking for, be it by producer, type, varietal, vintage, region or rating. Drinkability reports sort wine by quantity and drinking window, helping maintain your cellar by locating bottles at their peak. Tag your favorite wines for later reference and view your consumption history.

Detailed information on each wine from the world's largest wine database is just a tap away.  Read community tasting notes and scores, view label images, and display your inventory, including location.  Everything you need to evaluate a bottle is at your fingertips.  Once you have made the perfect choice, mark the bottle as consumed and include private notes.

Supports Just Type for quick cellar searches.

If you are currently a CellarTracker user, simply log in with your current account information.  If you are new to CellarTracker, create an account and enter information on your inventory directly into CellarTracker from your web browser.

NOTE: The ability to perform the following functions is currently unimplemented, pending permission and/or enhancements to the CellarTracker API to allow them:
- Add bottles
- Move bottles
- Add tasting notes
- Receive pending shipments

If you experience issues or have feedback, please contact Rocobo through the in app help menu before leaving a negative review. We cannot provide support through the App Catalog review system. We strive to make a quality product.


1.0.1 Update: Fix cellar icons for certain white wine types
versionNote: Fix cellar icons for certain white wine types that were improperly displaying
